author: Anonymous Atom
title: height binary search tree
question:
Hi, I was just doing the binary search tree exercise about determining the height of a tree. 
I was wondering how the max function works. I tried to search the helpdesk, but couldn't find much. I thought max is used for numbers. 
(@htdf height)
(@signature BST -> Natural)
;; produce max height of BST 
(check-expect (height BST0) 0)
(check-expect (height BST1) 1)
(check-expect (height BST3) 3)
(check-expect (height BST42) 3)
(check-expect (height BST10) 4)

(@template BST)

(define (height bst)
  (cond [(false? bst) 0]
        [else 
         (+ 1
            (max (height (node-l bst))
                 (height (node-r bst))))]))
instructor_answer:
The helpdesk has the documentation for max.  Have you tried going into the interactions pane and typing expressions like these two:
(max 2 3)


(max (height BST1) (height BST2))
